newsArray.title: Utilita Bowl to switch on over 1,000 solar panels ahead of England vs Australia
creator: Nick Rewcastle
newsArray.description: Utilita Bowl will today, Wednesday 11 September, see over 1,000 newly installed solar panels turned on for the first time, ahead of England taking on Australia in Southampton.

creator: Web Desk
newsArray.description: Former Pakistan captain Salman Butt has been included in the commentary panel for the upcoming Champions One-Day Cup, alongside notable names like Sikander Bakht, Marina Iqbal, Ali Younis, and Shah Faisal.

newsArray.title: Rohit Sharma Cannot Stop Smiling Amid 'Serious' Workout Sessions, Video Goes Viral | WATCH
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description: Rohit Sharma, Team India's Test and ODI captain, shared a workout video on social media which has quickly gone viral. The senior India batter is known being his candid self on the field and the same seems to have seeped into his gym sessions as well. In the latest clip, Rohit can be seen sharing several hilarious moments even during an intense training session.The video which Rohit has uploaded is divided into two parts with the first portion of the clip titled 'Workouts- 99 per cent of the time' in which he can be seen running and lifting weights, with the second part of the video titled 'That 1 per cent' in which the 37-year-old can be seen having a gala time with his friends.READ HERE | IND vs BAN: Rohit Sharma & Co. Issued Stern Warning By Bangladesh's 150-Kmph PacerTake a look at the viral video here: View this post on Instagram A post shared by Rohit Sharma (@rohitsharma45)Rohit Sharma Working On His Fitness Ahead Of IND vs BAN TestsNotably, Rohit is working on his fitness ahead of the IND vs BAN Tests. While Rohit was seen working out in a park with assistant coach coach Abhishek Nayar, several videos of him engaging in intense workouts have surfaced online.ALSO READ | On Rohit Sharma's Communication Style, Rishabh Pant Says 'Don't Understand...'On the workfront, Rohit has been named the captain of the India vs Bangladesh 1st Test which gets underway at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai on September 19. The second Test will be played at the Green Park Stadium in Kanpur from September 27. The two Test matches will be followed by a three-match T20I series beginning on October 6 in Gwalior.

newsArray.title: भारत-बांग्लादेश टेस्ट सीरीज से पहले इस दिग्गज ने दिया इस्तीफा, ICC ट्रॉफी जीताने में निभाई थी अहम भूमिका
creator: TV9 Bharatvarsh
newsArray.description: बांग्लादेश क्रिकेट बोर्ड में एक बड़ा बदलाव देखने को मिला है. बांग्लादेश के पूर्व कप्तान खालिद महमूद ने बांग्लादेश क्रिकेट बोर्ड के निदेशक पद से इस्तीफा दे दिया है. वह साल 2013 से इस पद पर थे.

newsArray.title: Will Steve Smith Continue Opening the Batting in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024-25? Australia Head Coach Andrew McDonald Makes Big Revelation Ahead of Marquee Test Series Against India
newsArray.description: Steve Smith was promoted to the opening position in Test matches to fill in for a retired David Warner and also to improve his dwindling. Fans eager to know whether Smith would continue batting at the top in the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024-25 can read more.

newsArray.title: Persistent rain forces Day 3 of Greater Noida Test to be called off
creator: Priyan
newsArray.description: Rain and the state of the outfield at Greater Noida Sports Complex Ground rendered the third day of the one-off Test between Afghanistan and New Zealand a non-starter. Play was abandoned as early as 9.15 am. With no play possible on either of the first two days, and the toss yet to happen, the chances [...]

newsArray.title: Video: शाकिब अल हसन 17 साल बाद इस तरह हुए आउट, इंग्लैंड के गेंदबाज ने किया खेल खत्म
creator: TV9 Bharatvarsh
newsArray.description: पाकिस्तान के खिलाफ टेस्ट सीरीज में बांग्लादेश को ऐतिहासिक जीत दिलाने में अहम भूमिका निभाने वाले शाकिब अल हसन भारत दौरे से पहले इंग्लैंड में प्रैक्टिस कर रहे हैं, जहां काउंटी चैंपियनशिप मैच के दौरान इंग्लैंड के अनुभवी स्पिनर जैक लीच ने अपना शिकार बनाया. शाकिब इस पारी में सिर्फ 12 रन बना पाए.

newsArray.description: The captains of the five teams posed together with the Pakistan Champions Cup 2024 trophy which is all set to begin from September 12 at the Iqbal Stadium in Faisalabad.
